removals.reasoning: The outer parentheses around the cast are redundant; keeping the cast parentheses is sufficient and clearer.
Same as above: the extra outer parentheses around the cast are unnecessary.
Outer parentheses are redundant around this cast expression.
The extra outer parentheses are unnecessary; also removing the inner parentheses around the address yields the more idiomatic (uint8_t*)&gridDimPacked.
Outer parentheses are redundant; (uint8_t*)&gridDim is clearer and equivalent.
Remove redundant outer parentheses; collapse to the standard cast-of-address form.
Outer parentheses are unnecessary and the shorter form is equivalent and clearer.
In the function call argument, the extra outer parentheses around the cast are redundant.
Remove redundant outer parentheses around the cast.
Outer parentheses around the cast are unnecessary.
Remove the redundant outer parentheses; the cast itself must remain.
Same: extra outer parentheses are not needed.
The cast is needed but the extra outer parentheses are redundant in the function call.
Only one set of parentheses around the cast expression is needed; the outermost extra parentheses can be removed.
Remove redundant outer parentheses around the nested cast.
The outer parentheses are unnecessary; keep the cast but drop the extra grouping.
Redundant outer parentheses around the cast can be removed.
Remove the extra outer parentheses; the remaining cast is sufficient.
Parentheses around the single variable in a cast are redundant: (double)(i) is equivalent to (double)i and the latter is clearer.
Same reasoning: remove unnecessary parentheses around the variable in the cast.
The outer parentheses around the entire right-hand expression are not needed for the assignment; leaving the casts intact preserves meaning.
Parentheses around the index expression are unnecessary; the index can be written without them.
Remove redundant parentheses around the single variable being cast.
Parentheses around the variable are unnecessary in the cast.
Remove redundant parentheses around the variable in the cast.
Outer grouping is unnecessary; with casts simplified the multiplication/division order is unchanged.
Index expression parentheses are redundant.
Remove unnecessary parentheses around the variable in the cast (same pattern as above).
Parentheses around a single variable in a cast are redundant.
Remove redundant parentheses around the variable in the cast.
Outer parentheses are unnecessary; the operator precedence among * and / preserves the intended computation.

The inner parentheses around the addition are redundant because the subtraction/grouping that follows already ensures the numerator is evaluated before division; preserving one set of parentheses to group the entire numerator is sufficient.
Parentheses around a single variable passed as a function argument are unnecessary and reduce readability.
Remove redundant parentheses around the format string variable in the function call.
